summary:
1. The definition of a dog is a complex and challenging concept to grasp.
2. However, the domestication of wolves is believed to have played a significant role in the evolution of modern humans.
3. This process of turning wild wolves into domesticated dogs is considered a major achievement in human history.
4. It allowed for the development of a symbiotic relationship between humans and dogs, leading to their widespread domestication.
5. The domestication of dogs also provided humans with a reliable companion, protector, and helper in various tasks.
6. This partnership between humans and dogs is believed to have played a crucial role in the success and dominance of humans as a species.
7. Dogs have also been used for specific purposes such as hunting, herding, and even as therapy animals.
8. Their intelligence, loyalty, and adaptability have made them one of the most beloved and versatile animals in the world.
9. Despite the various breeds and sizes, all dogs share a common ancestor - the wolf - and continue to hold a special place in human society.
10. The domestication of wolves into dogs marks a significant turning point in human history, shaping the world as we know it today.

searches.title: What Is a Dog Anyway? | Scientific American
searches.description: Defining what a dog is is really tough, but the domestication of wolves might be the feat that set modern humans on the path to dominance

searches.title: Dog facts for kids! | National Geographic Kids
searches.description: Sink your teeth into 10 awesome dog facts from Nat Geo Kids! Find out about dogs' super senses, training talents, and more...

searches.title: Dogs - Information, Facts & Pictures
searches.description: Dogs were domesticated from wolves around 15,000 years ago. New evidence suggests they were first domesticated in East Asia, possibly China

What is a dog? | Britannica
searches.description: What is a dog?  A dog is a domestic mammal of the family Canidae and the order Carnivora. Its scientific name is Canis lupus familiaris. Dogs are a su

searches.title: Dog | History, Domestication, Physical Traits, Breeds, & Facts | Britannica
searches.description: A dog is a domestic mammal of the family Canidae (order Carnivora). It is a subspecies of the gray wolf and is related to foxes and jackals. The dog is one of the two most ubiquitous and most popular domestic animals in the world (the cat is the other). It has lived with humans for more than 12,000 years.

searches.title: Dog Definition & Meaning - Merriam-Webster
searches.description: The meaning of DOG is a carnivorous mammal (Canis familiaris) closely related to the gray wolf that has long been domesticated as a pet, occurs in a variety of sizes, colors, and coat types, and is sometimes trained to perform special tasks (such as herding, guarding, or acting as a service animal). How to use dog in a sentence.
